Literature Review: Protein hydrogen exchange (HX) has emerged as a crucial tool in understanding the intricate mechanisms of protein function, folding, and allosteric regulation. Our journey into the world of HX began with a serendipitous encounter, which eventually led to a series of groundbreaking advances in measurement, interpretation, and biophysical applications. This literature review aims to provide an overview of the current state of knowledge on HX, focusing on its role in allosteric structure and energy change, protein folding, and the fascinating realm of protein machines.

References.title: Protein Hydrogen Exchange: A Powerful Tool for Studying Protein Structure and Dynamics
Allosteric Regulation of Hemoglobin: A Paradigm for Protein Allosteric Control
Protein Folding: From Local Conformations to Global Structures
The AAA+ Proteins: A Family of ATP-Dependent Proteases
Protein Machines: The Next Frontier in Structural Biology
Hydrogen Exchange and the Study of Protein Dynamics
References.journal: Journal of Biomolecular Structure and Dynamics
